Academic Continuity               Blackboard             UIC Box            Webex              Webinars                    Zoom                        COVID-19 Information & Resources  Officials at the University of Illinois at Chicago, the University of Illinois System and public health officials locally and nationally, are closely monitoring an outbreak of respiratory illness caused by a novel (new) coronavirus, named COVID-19.  UIC has created a central webpage to bring the latest news and information about COVID-19 to the campus community. Use the link below to stay informed.   COVID-19 UPDATES           Service Notices        VoIP phone issues [update]  Friday, May 8, 2020  5/9/20, 3:00am — We are aware that some users may be experiencing issues calling on-campus VoIP phones. ACCC VoIP engineers continue working with AT&T and Cisco support to troubleshoot the problem. There is no expected downtime during this time period, but please be aware that a brief interruption…          UIC Web Site Maintenance 5/10  Friday, May 8, 2020  ACCC will be performing maintenance on the UIC web site (uic.edu) Sunday, May 10, from 4:00pm to 9:00pm. This maintenance will include security enhancements, improve reliability,  and align better with the UIC brand.…              Recent News Articles           Did You Know? UofI Was First to Launch Computer-Assisted Learning!  Thursday, May 7, 2020  It was 1960 when computer scientists at the University of Illinois launched the first generalized computer-assisted instruction program. They called it PLATO (Programmed Logic for Automatic Teaching Operations), and it ran on UofI’s ILLIAC computer.             Instructor Resources for Summer Online Teaching  Wednesday, April 29, 2020  When COVID-19 had us all staying home in mid-March, instructors had to move spring semester classes online.
